CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The PffBB-n ( n = 10 , 12 , 14 , or 16 ) polymers were synthesized according to the optimized literature procedures and the synthetic scheme is shown in Scheme 1.^39 The Corey - House synthesis of 3-bromothiophene and oxalyl dichloride gave 1,2di(thiophen-3-yl)ethane-1,2-dione ( 1 ) as a brown needle - like crystal in a good yield ( 70% ).

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PffBB-n (n = 10, 12, 14, or 16) |
| 3-bromothiophene |
| oxalyl dichloride |
| 1,2-di(thiophen-3-yl)ethane-1,2-dione (1) |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

I apologize for the mistake in my previous response. Here are the valid entities that clearly refer to "Material name" in the given paragraph, presented as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PffBB-n (n = 10, 12, 14, or 16) |
| 1,2-di(thiophen-3-yl)ethane-1,2-dione (1) |

I removed "3-bromothiophene" and "oxalyl dichloride" from the list as they do not clearly refer to material names.

Paragraph: The PffBB-n ( n = 10 , 12 , 14 , or 16 ) polymers were synthesized according to the optimized literature procedures and the synthetic scheme is shown in Scheme 1.^39 The Corey - House synthesis of 3-bromothiophene and oxalyl dichloride gave 1,2di(thiophen-3-yl)ethane-1,2-dione ( 1 ) as a brown needle - like crystal in a good yield ( 70% ).

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| n | 10, 12, 14, or 16 |
| 1 | 1,2-di(thiophen-3-yl)ethane-1,2-dione |
| 70% | 70% |

Note:

* n is a variable representing the number of repeating units in the PffBB-n polymers.
* 1 is the chemical name of the compound synthesized through the Corey-House synthesis.
* 70% is the yield of the compound synthesized through the Corey-House synthesis.

Note that the values 10, 12, 14, and 16 refer to the number of repeating units in the PffBB-n polymers, which is a property of the material. The value 70% refers to the yield of the compound synthesized through the Corey-House synthesis, which is also a property of the material.
